description: Just one part of the famous Kettle Valley Railway.Time to complete will vary due to type of activity and how long you wish to look at the artifacts.Like all railways the distances were measured in miles and these miles are posted still to indicate stationing.171.4   Chute Lake Station171.6   Chute Creek171.7   Elinor Lake Forest Service Road171.9   Chute Creek172.0   Chute Creek172.1   Chute Creek172.2   Chute Creek-Rock Oven #12172.3   Chute Creek174.1   Access road to Chute Lake Road177.1   Cattle Guard180.4   Rock Oven #11180.8   Elinor Lake Forest Service Road-North Fork Smethurst Road  Rock Oven #10181.4   Rock Oven #9181.9   Adra Station182.9   Rock Oven #8183.1   Adra Tunnel bypass Trail183.3   Adra Tunnel183.8   Tunnel Exit183.9   South Fork Smethurst Roa184.4   Adra Tunnel bypass Trail186.3   Rock Ovens #1, 2, 3186.5   Elinor Lake Forest Service Road-North Fork Smethurst Road 187.1   Rock Ovens #4, 5, 7-Tote Road Trail187.9   Trust Creek-Rock Oven #6188.1   Power Line192.0   Glenfir Station192.1   Chute Lake Road196.3   Little Tunnel196.8   Horseshoe Trail200.9   Smethurst Road 201.2   Naramata Creek201.9   Arawana Creek202.2   Arawana Station202.4   Arawana Road206.9   Sutherland Road207.4   Hillside Winery207.7   Poplar Grove Station-Riddle Road208.4   Naramata Road209.0   Davenport Road209.4   Lochore Road209.6   Randolf Creek-McCulloch210.0   Carder Road210.5   Lakeview Cemetary212.0  Wreck of Little Joe Raymond212.2   Fork in Trail212.3   Vancouver Ave.212.4   Townley St.212.6   Westminster Ave.212.8   Nanaimo Ave.213.3   Pickering St.213.4   Penticton Creek213.5   Eckhardt Ave. East213.7   Gahan Ave.213.9   Jermyn Ave.214.1   Main St.Bike shop / rentals: Freedom Bike Shop Accomodations: Summerland Resort
directions: From Main St. get on the Naramata Road and follow till you see the Chute Lake sign. Folllow all the way to Chute Lake.
title: Kettle Valley Railway. Chute Lake to Penticton
